current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to
		  clarify the Food and Drug Administration’s jurisdiction over certain tobacco
		  products, and to protect jobs and small businesses involved in the sale,
		  manufacturing and distribution of traditional and premium
		  cigars.

committee-name.#text:
Committee
			 on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which was
			 read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and
			 Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2013

text.#text:
Nothing in this
				chapter shall be construed to grant the

means any roll of tobacco that is wrapped
				in 100 percent leaf tobacco, bunched with 100 percent tobacco filler, contains
				no filter, tip or non-tobacco mouthpiece, weighs at least 6 pounds per 1,000
				count, and—

has a 100 percent
				leaf tobacco binder and is hand rolled;

has a 100 percent leaf tobacco binder and
				is made using human hands to lay the leaf tobacco wrapper or binder onto only
				one machine that bunches, wraps, and caps each individual cigar; or

has a
				homogenized tobacco leaf binder and is made in the United States using human
				hands to lay the 100 percent leaf tobacco wrapper onto only one machine that
				bunches, wraps, and caps each individual cigar; and
